events.title: Founding of the United States Marine Corps
events.description: The Continental Congress establishes the Continental Marines as a maritime infantry force for the newly formed United States.
events.significance: This marks the creation of the United States Marine Corps, a key branch of the U.S. Armed Forces known for amphibious and expeditionary warfare.

events.title: Henry Morton Stanley locates David Livingstone
events.description: Journalist and explorer Henry Morton Stanley finds Dr. David Livingstone, a missionary and explorer, in Ujiji, near Lake Tanganyika in Africa, reportedly greeting him with 'Dr. Livingstone, I presume?'.
events.significance: This event symbolizes European exploration in Africa during the 19th century and reignited interest in the African continent.

events.title: Velvet Revolution culminates in the formation of the first non-communist government in Czechoslovakia since 1948
events.description: Following peaceful protests, the Communist government resigns, and VÃ¡clav Havel becomes president, marking a significant step in ending communist rule in Eastern Europe.
events.significance: Marks the transition of Czechoslovakia from communist rule to democracy during the broader collapse of Eastern Bloc communist regimes.

events.title: Alexander Fleming discovers penicillin
events.description: Fleming observes that a mold (Penicillium notatum) killing bacteria leads to the discovery of penicillin, the first true antibiotic.
events.significance: Penicillin revolutionizes medicine by providing an effective treatment for bacterial infections, saving countless lives.
